dialogue: Goddamit. Throwing the cab in drive-
You’re my last fare for the night.
You fuckin’ won, sweetheart. You did.
And... What do I get? For winning?

Yeah, I had a rough day of it. Short trips, barely nothin’ extra. This fuckin’ business with the credit cards. When it was cash? People’d throw you a ten, twenty, fifty. “Keep the change” ain’t a cliché no more.

It’s these fuckin’ apps, all of ‘em - can get a coffee, burger, soap, socks, wine, water, weed, fuckin’ Chinese takeout - you can get all that shit, and never reach for your purse, not even for tip. Nah, it’s all up in that cloud up there. That big fuckin’ cloud, thinkin’ it knows better. Swearin’ it can keep a secret. But what happens when that cloud starts leakin’, huh? What happens when it starts to rain? You bet your ass we’re gonna wish we’d stuck with the Monopoly money, am I right? I mean... salt used to be money. Mother fuckin’ salt. The same shit you sprinkle on your eggs. Yeah. Every mornin’ you toss that cheap-ass-shit all over your eggs with no idea that people used to die for it. Tea, coffee, same thing. All that shit you gloss over at the grocery store, at one point in time, humans fuckin’ killed each other for it. Bird’s eye view of that shit? Over the years, you see money go from salt to gold to paper and now? Money? It ain’t nothin’ but an idea. Little numbers on a screen. You can’t touch it, can’t bury it, can’t put a little “x” that marks the spot- Nah... you just tie it to a fuckin’ butterfly and send it to that cloud up there. But, one of these days, I’m tellin’ ya, that cloud’s gonna open up and it’s gonna pour acid rain down, all over our dumb faces... Yellow cabs don’t play that game. Not in New York. Too much bullshit. Playfully, Girlie offers a clever smirk.
Yeah. My bag in the back should settle us.

That’s good... For that- You can use a damn credit card, honey. It is what it is at this point. But, back in the day, shit, we fought it, we all fought it. Cash is king, ya know? Million dollars for a fuckin’ Medallion, and they still put that credit card shit in my back seat. And one day soon, like that, they’re gonna come back and rip it out again, like it was nothin’... Credit card machines, they’re gonna be like fuckin’ pay phones. Just sittin’ there. Lookin’ dumb. Waitin’. Waitin’ for somebody, anybody to give ‘em a ring. Havin’ no idea... the world’s moved on. And... I guess I’m no different. I mean... cabs, yellow cabs? We’re fuckin’ Blockbuster, ya know? We’re fightin’ it all too hard, swimmin’ up stream. Busy swimmin’ and missin’ the whole fuckin’ boat... Me, too. I been fightin’ it, too. Swimmin’, swimmin’ hard... But... I don’t know... If we’re Blockbuster... it’s already too late. Ten years time, there ain’t gonna be no yellow no more. And all those other guys, the ones with the apps, the guys takin’ over? They are gonna be nothin’ but a blip on the screen. Fuckin’ blink of an eye... when it’s all said and done.
Yeah, it all sounds the same. ‘Specially in my business. After so many hours, drivin’ around... all sounds the same.
You-uh... you ever get a cabbie before that was-uh... ya know... that was born state-side?
Uh... I’ve never thought about it.
I don’t know, I... I guess I haven’t.
Is that supposed to mean something?
Not really. I mean... some people... Sometimes people ask about it.
Yeah. Like, one guy, some Wall Street fuckin’ douche... he wanted to know why.
Why I’m drivin’ a cab. Wanted to know how I fucked up so bad.
That’s... disturbing. For a lot of reasons.
Right?! I fuckin’ pull over, right then, turn around and tell the guy, “Ride’s over, buddy, get the fuck outta my cab.” Guy jumps out, don’t even pay.

It’s just... weird, ya know? I mean. I used to be exactly what you’d expect behind the wheel of a New York City cab. And now... I don’t know. I guess. Nothin’ stays the same no-more... And... I guess... it’s better that way. For the most part. Can’t say I didn’t have a good run.
Nice you’re not on your phone. I mean, you don’t have to keep talkin’ to me or nothin’, but... it’s just nice. You know. To see a human. Not plugged in.
Yeah, I need a break from it.

Picked up a couple this mornin’, LaGuardia, older couple. And they got their-uh, I don’t know, their granddaughter with ‘em - fifteen, sixteen. And she’s just textin’, the whole ride. First time in the city, and she don’t say a word. I make a joke to grandma - I was like, “So, what, ya ask her questions and she texts ya the answers?” Grandma laughed, but Princess gives me a glare. A glare, mind you, but still no fuckin’ word - barely looked out the window. And get this shit. I drop ‘em off near Macy’s, right? Pop open the trunk, start helpin’ Grandpa with the bags - Empire State, right there. I point it out to Grandpa, he points it out to Princess, and all of a sudden, Princess holds out her phone and snaps a fuckin’ picture - all smilin’ at the camera, big toothy grin - lookin’ all excited and shit. And then... she’s back on her phone. Not smilin’. Not talkin’. Nothin’. Just sendin’ a fuckin’ butterfly to that cloud up there. Makin’ her friends all jealous she’s in the big city. When the truth is? In the rearview, Clark LOCKS EYES with Girlie-
Just like to know people’s names.
Fuck. You really are a human, aren’t ya? That’s sweet.
You thought I’d say Vinnie or some shit.
I... I don’t know what I thought.

Ah, it’s fine. I mean. Shit. We pass out these names, ya know, random ass names to these cute, little babies. Any name you want. Whatever-the-fuck has a nice ring to it. Whatever-the-fuck gives you high hopes for higher education and bullshit. But that little thing in your arms, it’s never gonna be exactly what you had in mind. I mean, Clark plays tennis, he’s got a house in the Hamptons, goes to opera and shit. I just ain’t that guy.
What name would you choose? If you could?
Yeah, your little outfit gave you away.
How can you possibly know that?

It ain’t that difficult to read people. I mean. You jumped in, business as usual, ya turned off that damn little screen back there, ‘cause you already know what fuckin’ Broadway shows are playin’, and you didn’t even think to reach for your seat belt. Why would you? You’ve had enough rides. In and out, am I right?
You gave me cross streets, not some recited fuckin’ address from your phone. And I can tell you’re not concerned with the meter, ‘cause you already know JFK’s a flat rate.

I’m not claimin’ to be some Sherlock or nothin’. Just a guy who pays attention. You’ve had a long day. You’re tired. You wanna go home, take a shower, sleep in your own bed. And. You got in line for a mother fuckin’ taxi. Now- That’s a New Yorker that pays attention. Someone who knows what the fuck’s goin’ on. And-
You’re not afraid to look me in the eye. Like I said. You can handle yourself.
I can’t remember, I just started learning
Yeah. Don’t people from Oklahoma - - talk like this?
Where ya from, what part of the state?
Okay, so... Oklahoma’s shaped like a pan, right? So if- If my arm’s the panhandle, then- I grew up here.
Huh. I honest-to-god would have never guessed Oklahoma.
Not an armpit, I can tell you that. How long you been in New York?
No shit. One more year, and I’ll be official.

Yeah... but let’s be honest, you’re official now. Anyone who chooses for nine years to wait at the post office until the idea of “goin’ postal” starts to have a nice ring to it - anyone who chooses for nine years to ride around in those little sardine cans underground, some guy rubbin’ up against you like some dog humpin’ your leg - anyone who chooses for nine years to drag loads of laundry down the street to fight off a tough-ass-broad for some machine that eats up all your quarters and gives ya bedbugs - and all for the privilege of gettin’ a whiff of that sweet ‘n sour piss aroma every now and again as you run down the street, eatin’ your mornin’ bagel? You’re a fuckin’ New Yorker. That is... unless you got money and don’t do any of that shit. That’s-uh... that’s a different New York, altogether. Might as well be another fuckin’ planet.
I did all that. For a long time.
Like ones and zeros and shit?
Like ones and zeros and shit. You thought I’d say something more girly, didn’t ya?
Yeah, like a weddin’ planner or fashion or somethin’.
Not as many women code, I’ll give you that.
And you drew a line in the sand. Lifted your leg and made your mark.
So... what’s the deal with the ones and zeros?
They’re like building blocks or whatnot, right? Like. When I look at my computer, I’m really lookin’ at a bunch of ones and zeros or some shit.
No, tell me. I honest-to-god wanna know. Can’t be a know-it-all if I don’t know nothin’.

Basically... a computer uses electricity to create “on” and “off” states that can represent ones and zeros. One being “on” and zero being “off.” But- They more often represent the idea of... “true” or “false.”
Ones and zeros mean... true or false?
Not always- They can also represent numbers and other things, too, but- Much of what I do is testing whether something is true or false. I’ve always used “one” to mean “true”- And-
Everything in a computer - color, images, music, money, three dimensional worlds, all of it - is represented by ones and zeros.
Correct. It’s basically how... everything you see... operates.

I mean... makes sense. We all do that. Lay down our bricks of ones and zeros and build our own little fort. And that shit, it starts young. I mean, think about it. “You are stupid.” True or false? “You are ugly.” True or false? “Your mother loves you.” True or false? And when you grow up? That shit don’t stop. “Climate Change.” True or false? “Jesus Christ.” True or false? “I must wear pants today.” True or fuckin’ false. And on and on it goes.
We all gotta choose our ones and zeros. And whatever we decide... yeah... that becomes the foundation from which we operate.
Or. Maybe I’m just talkin’ bullshit.
You’re a... you’re a surprising person, I gotta say.
Very little surprises me these days.
Hell’s Kitchen. Or. What was Hell’s Kitchen. Not too far from where we’re goin’.
What was it like, when you were a kid?
Back in my day? Man. If Hell really did have a kitchen... that was it. Junkies on every stoop. Hookers on every corner. It was fantastic.
Own a place. Jackson Heights. Small house.
No, no, no... Vinnie lives in Queens. Clark’s gotta loft in Tribeca.
Dammit. Got some kinda fender bender up there.
Sorry, sweetie. I hate this shit.
I fuckin’ know these roads like the back of my hand. But still can’t predict the weather, ya know?
It’s not fine. It’s not professional. Should’ve been payin’ attention- Could’ah got off back there.
Well? I’m on the flat rate, so-
Nah, I’m gonna meter your ass!
Nope. I won. I won again. Two to zero.
Leavin’ me in the dust over here.
How long were you in Oklahoma?
She’s... Honestly, she’s kind of a bitch.
How she a bitch? What she do?
Little things, like... she makes fun of my cankles.
I’m small and I have thick ankles.
I take it that... you and the bitch don’t visit all that often?
We just stopped talking. We didn’t have a fight or anything, we just... stopped talking.
She tracked me down. Asked me to visit. Had no reason to say no.
How she track you down? The cloud?
We had a nice time. I mean- She’s a total bitch, but we laughed a lot. We drank a lot and we laughed a lot.
Fuck me. She Native American or somethin’?
Yeah, they seem happy. Live in a trailer, just got a parakeet... saving up to do some traveling next year.

She-uh... she was eleven when I was born, so... she was like a mom growing up. But she was a fucked up mom, like... she used to tie me up, ankle to ankle, wrist to wrist, and put me in the bathtub and lock me in the bathroom.
Why the fuck would she do that?
It was... her way of helping me practice.
If I ever got kidnapped, I’d be able to escape. That was her logic.
Did you like bein’ tied up?
I liked the challenge of getting free.
You got loose... didn’t ya? You sat there in that bathroom... in that cold, empty tub... for God knows how long... and you wiggled yourself free. Every. Fuckin’. Time.
Like I said... you can handle yourself.
You get a prize or somethin’? For gettin’ loose?
Not really. By the time I’d get free... my sister would be at work or whatever.
Mom went out for a pack of smokes and never came back.
That’s funny. You’re funny... What are you? Twenty-five? Twenty-six? Shaking her head-
No, I don’t answer that question.
What, you weird about your age or somethin’?
The whole world’s weird about my age! If I told you I was twenty-four or thirty- four, your opinion of me would drastically change.
For women? It is. It is fucking true. The moment we hit thirty, our value’s cut in half.
Fine, fuck it, it’s true. It is true. But, listen, you really do look twenty- somethin’, but - by the way you talk all smart and shit - if I wasn’t lookin’, I’d guess you were fifty, so-
So what does it matter how many times I’ve been around the sun?
Hell if I know... It’s just a question, I guess. Somethin’ people ask. Maybe you’re right, maybe it is bullshit. I guess... it’s just my way of... tryin’ to understand.
It is a bit confusin’ to meet some chick who looks twenty-two, but so clearly is a fuckin’ rocket ship.
Gonna take over the whole wide world, no question.
I’ll build a small empire and leave the rest.
You-uh... you plan on sharing that Empire with someone? A boyfriend or... girlfriend or... whatnot?
What? You need me to kick someone’s ass?
Come on. I told you my name, let’s hear his.
Oh. I see. I get it.
Why do you think he’s married?

You could’ve said his name and how would I ever know? As if there’s only one Bob or Sam or Jeff in New-York-fuckin’-City. Nah... you so afraid to say a name? The guy’s married. Or you’re married. Or someone’s fuckin’ married and no one wants to say that shit out loud. Gum?
I know he’s fuckin’ married. I know people. Don’t drive a cab for twenty years and not know people.
Word of advice? And this is comin’ from a man married twice with a lotta action on the side - ya ready? Don’t ever say the word “love.” All right? Just... don’t say it.
Oh, sweetheart... You fuckin’ said it, didn’t you?

You did! You said the fuckin’ “L” word! Oh, God, honey! That’s fuckin’ suicide in that world, didn’t you know that?! Fuck! He does not want to hear that from you. He wants to hear it from his mother, his wife, his kids - but he does not want to hear that shit from you. In the cognitive wheel that is his life, that is not your function.
Sex! Touch me, suck me, lick me, but do not love me. Don’t you fuckin’ love me.
I’m not... that girl, okay? I just- I couldn’t not say it anymore.

And what? He’s supposed to love you back? He’s supposed to ride in on a big, white horse and whisk you away to some cliff in Greece? Live out his days braidin’ your hair with wild flowers and forget-me- nots? No fuckin’ way. He’s not gonna be there when your olive oil dries up, sweetheart. You’re not that important. He knows that, I know that, but you - you just gotta catch up, it’s all right. Gotta change your ones to zeros, sweetie, I get it, it takes time.

Honest-to-God, my first wife was everything you’d ever want. Five-eight, hundred and fifteen pounds, tits out to here - hair full of bleach and a head full of nothin’. Men love women that are dumb as shit. They’re fuckin’ pigs in the bedroom. Mother-fuckin’-pigs and we love that shit.
Cannot reduce themselves to pigs in the bedroom. That is right. Can’t have it both ways, don’t exist.
You’re a smart girl, went to college - read a lot, talk politics, all that shit?
You ever been a pig in the bedroom?
What’s your definition of a pig?
You see! Dumb chicks don’t need explainin’ - they just do it! That was my first wife. Man... everything a guy could ask for.
But, uh... she-uh... she starts gainin’ weight, right? And it makes her feel bad about herself and she stops wantin’ to, ya know-
Do her wifely duty or whatnot. And, in no time flat, honest-to-God, I go out and find myself a nineteen-year-old, put her up in an apartment down the street, pay for the whole damn thing.
Oh, yeah. Cute little thing. Polish. Long legs. Fucked the shit out of her. Best year of my life. Would’ve kept her around longer, but-

Not your function. You are there because their wives had kids and got fat. Or their wives have a career, or cancer, or whatever-the-fuck it is - men don’t want to hear that shit come outta your mouth. They barely want you to say a word at all.
So why get married? Why don’t men just stay single so they can fuck whoever, whenever?

Men? We wanna look good for other men, if that makes sense. We wanna have a fancy suit, big house, fast car. “He who dies with the most toys wins.” Sure, that’s talkin’ about the suit, the house, the car, but... it also includes the wife and the kids. Toys. Now. Lotta guys out there, maybe they did fall in love. Maybe they really did wanna get married and have kids and whatever- the-fuck. But deep down? If they’re honest? Real-honest? Lookin’ like a family man’s more important than bein’ one.
There are good men out there.
Yeah... But they are very few and very far... Much more than you would ever wanna know.
Different reasons. Women wanna feel sexy. But they wanna feel sexy, ‘cause they wanna feel wanted, and they wanna feel wanted, ‘cause they wanna feel loved. And, there it is - the “L” word again.
That is just such bullshit. I am certain there are plenty of women out there that can cheat just like a fucking man!

Sure, sure. There are women out there that just wanna get fucked, no question. But, those women... they don’t just fuck any Joe Blow down the street. Nah. They reserve their skills for men that have money. Men who have power. Thus, causing the whole world of men to want money and power all the more. The suit, the house, the car - we want those things, because we want those skilled women to fuck us senseless, like a man, no strings attached. Therefore? You ladies fightin’ so hard to be our equal, is actually, in essence, still reducing most of you to nothin’ but toys. And so the cycle continues.
I seriously hate you right now. This is everything that is wrong with the world.
Look. At the end of the day, I do agree with ya. Man or woman, people are people.
And people get lonely. Don’t matter the reason. Humans just want a soft spot to rest their heads. For an hour even... one fuckin’ hour to forget yourself. But... in your particular case...
You mean it. You don’t use the “L” word unless you mean it, do ya? And that puts you in the “stereotypical category” as much as it makes you hate me.

Look. I know you’re not “that girl,” all right? I get it. I can tell. All the little boys out there, they been chasin’ you. You don’t remember their names, you don’t wanna cuddle, and you most definitely don’t use the “L” word. You wanna get in, get out, go home, take a shower and sleep in your own bed. It’s not about havin’ babies for you. It’s not about bullshit. It’s about bein’ distracted. Just long enough that you can forget about... whatever-the-fuck happened in Gage, Oklahoma all those years ago. But then... one day... for whatever reason... this guy grabs your attention. And suddenly... you don’t know yourself. Suddenly, you want things you never fuckin’ wanted. Am I right?

Good news is... you’ll know right when it happens next time, ‘cause you’ll actually know what the fuck’s goin’ on. Won’t be caught with your panties down on the next round, sweetie. Unless you wanna be.
Please just- Don’t say “panties.” Call them literally anything else.

Oh, yeah. You’ll meet someone. Doesn’t matter where. And the-uh, the conversation’ll start to go a certain way. Men know how to do that. Steer the talk to see if there’s interest. When you met your fella, he was doin’ the same thing. He was pokin’ around to see if you had any candy to give. And the answer, clearly, was yes.

Whether you knew it or not, you told him, “Yeah, I got candy.” So, he kept pushin’ and pokin’ ‘til he got it. And there you were, thinkin’ how great this guy is and how nice he’s listenin’ and, oh, such a perfect smile, so warm behind the eyes. Bullshit. Bull-fuckin’-shit, sweetheart. It wasn’t no accident. He’s done it before, he’ll do it again. Ain’t nothin’ special about it. And now?!
I gotta piss like a fuckin’ racehorse.
Oh-no- Do not do that in here!
Fuck am I supposed to do?
Who the fuck’s gonna arrest you? Come on, Hell’s Kitchen, like you’ve never taken a piss outside before.
He gave me his card. He didn’t ask for my number or anything.
No. That’s my point. He gave me his card and I e-mailed him, not the other way around.

Uh-huh. Yeah. He’s good. I bet that man gives out a shit ton of cards, wherever he goes. It’s a numbers game. Sometimes he gets the candy, sometimes he don’t. But you better believe he’s dishing out those cards like it’s fuckin’ ice cream. And when you contacted him, sweetie, you gave away your first piece of candy.
How long it take for him to switch you over to somethin’... a little more private?
Blink of a fuckin’ eye, am I right? No reply.

He wasn’t lookin’ for love, sweetheart. He wasn’t lookin’ to replace his wife. Who the hell wants to go to all that trouble? Nah. He’s all set up, the way he wants to be. He was just lookin’ for another toy to play with. And clearly... he found it. For all your smarts and all the time and effort and everything you’ve clearly done to make yourself a fuckin’ fortress... somehow... you have found yourself back in that bathtub again. Your hands and legs all tied up. Fightin’ so hard to get free.
One to two. I’m catchin’ up. So over this conversation-
You have said very little, in a very long time, that I didn’t already know.
Listen... I run my mouth off sometimes... That’s my problem. I like to push buttons.
And stuff like this. It’s just somethin’ people don’t wanna talk about. Who fuckin’ talks about this shit? No one.

Look... I can tell you’re a wonderful person. A human. Askin’ my name and shit. You got a good heart. I can see that. Which is why... I just gotta tell ya that... you’re better off just walkin’ away. And I say all this, not ‘cause I think I’m smarter than you are, I’m sayin’ it ‘cause... I used to be that guy. Doin’ what your guy’s doin’. But now- I mean- Honestly- The way you look right now... that face of yours, all sad and shit... it’s why I don’t go for the full candy no more.
He could be my father, yes.
So... I’m guessin’ you don’t have a daddy, right?
But you don’t have a daddy. And you wanted him to be your daddy, am I right?

Nothin’ fucked up about that. I mean... I don’t know much about psychology or whatnot, but it don’t take rocket-science to know that you got a little girl inside you. The little girl you used to be. She didn’t go nowhere. And that little girl didn’t have a daddy, but she still fuckin’ needs a daddy, right? So, you meet this guy, what, with his bald head and liver spots - whatever the hell he’s got goin’ on - would make most girls your age wanna puke, but not you. ‘Cause he’s everything you missed out on back in the day. He’s all the things your friends had, but you didn’t fuckin’ have. And now, years later, yeah, you meet this older guy, and the little girl on the inside, she just wants her daddy to hold her, tell her nice things, read her bedtime stories. But, the grown woman you are on the outside wants, well... she wants a different kinda bedtime story, if you catch my drift. Put the two together, and that guy gets a chance at havin’ somethin’ he would’ve never fuckin’ touched otherwise.
You. He’s a lucky son-of-a-bitch to have gotten your candy, if you don’t mind my sayin’.
Nah, I think they just waited.

Come on, this day and age? You wanna picture, you can find a mothah-fuckin’ picture. Hell, for a little salt? You can even find out where they live. Shit, the last three places they’ve lived if you set your mind to it.
Why do you care if he has kids or a wife or any of it? What does it matter to you?

I guess... I don’t know... Guess I’ve always been curious. ‘Bout people. Gets me into trouble, I’m not gonna lie. I got a mouth on me, and I need to learn how to zip it now and again, I do know that. I guess, I-uh... To be honest, I drive this beast around and... can’t do much else but think, ya know? And when you think too much, you ask too many questions. Nothin’ special about it. But, hey, it ain’t all for nothin’, I mean... who else you gonna talk to about this shit? Not like you’re ever gonna see me again.
I found one picture of her. They’re pretty private.
They’re at some corporate thing. Like an award thing.
What are they doin’? In the picture?
They’re just... smiling. They’re sitting next to each other and... they’re just... smiling at the camera.
And... they look... normal. They just look normal.
What, he some kinda big-shot or somethin’? Someone I’d recognize?
How old is she? The wife?
She’s lovely. She has this huge smile, like a really happy smile. I looked at that photo for a long time. It gave me this strange feeling like, maybe... maybe she and I could have been friends.
Yeah. Maybe. Another time, another place. Maybe. Ever meet the kids?
No kiddin’. That is some fuckin’ trust right there. That is some real fuckin’ trust. Huh.
I don’t know. But you did somethin’.
He let you in. As far as anyone in your position can possibly go.
And what am I supposed to do with that?
Look. It don’t change nothin’. But it is a compliment.
He showed me this... this video of his daughter, dancing. Three years old and... she’s wearing this red cape. Like a princess cape or something. And she’s just... twirling and twirling.
Dancin’ for her daddy. That’s sweet. You ever dance like that for your daddy? Your real daddy, I mean. When you were a kid?
I had a cape though. A long purple cape. Made me think I could fly.
Cape wasn’t lyin’. You can fly just fine.
My purple cape. It’s the only thing I kept. From back then.
You should. Every once in a while.
It’s under my bed. In a garbage bag.
Pull that shit out, put that shit on, and walk down the fuckin’ street. In this town? No one’s gonna bat an eye.
So, what about the twins? What do they do?
They’re silly. They like to shake their butts at the camera and say, “Nanny-Nanny- boo-boo.”
Guess it don’t matter either way. They’re still gonna get a pop on the ass for wavin’ it around.
Nothin’ “Nanny” or “Nanna” can do ‘bout it, am I right?
Ah, they seem like good kids.
And you get the feelin’ you coulda been friends. With the kids. Another time, another place.
Yeah, well... He can pretend to be a daddy to you... but he’s gotta be a real daddy to them, so... you get why you ain’t goin’ to Greece.
Shit. That ain’t no fender bender.
Eleven years... that’s a big difference.
Your sister. Bein’ that much older.
Yeah... she was only seventeen when we both left home. I was six.
I... went to live with her.
Can’t imagine any Oklahoma judge sayin’ that was all right.
No. No one said it was all right. But that’s what happened.
You live in the armpit? With your sister?
We moved to Woodward, actually. About twenty minutes away. Into her boyfriend’s house.
Why’d you go live with your sister? Your daddy do somethin’? Somethin’ he shouldn’t have done?
No, it was never like that.
He-uh... he actually... he never touched me. He just... he never touched me.
It’s actually an easy thing to do, not touch someone.
It didn’t have to be a hug. Pat on the back would have been nice. A fuckin’ high- five.
But... the day we left... I remember my sister... jumped in her car and... my dad was sitting on the porch.

And just before I left... I turned around and... I looked at him. And he looked at me. And then he... got up and walked over to me... and he reached out... and he shook my hand. I’d never shaken anyone’s hand before, I was six... I was just little, ya know...
But I knew what it meant.
What he look like? Your pop?
You’ll know it when you see it.
You’ll know it when you see it.
Oh, yeah. A real, real good’n.
Huh. Gonna put that on my list. You know, before I die. Number twenty two: Meet a mother fuckin’ cowboy.
What else is on your list?

Like, I-uh... I learned how to scuba dive last year. Took a trip to Nassau. Sat on the edge of a boat and - they make you fall backward, right? You fall back in the water, and... start to let the air outta your sails. And down, down, down you go... I mean, I didn’t go too far. Don’t have the trainin’ for the crazy stuff - shipwrecks and whatnot. But I did swim around this-uh, this mountain of coral, what with all these little fuckin’ clownfish and angelfish and barracuda and sponges and snapper and grouper. Saw a blue whale even. Yeah.
Yeah, wow. That was a big fuckin’ WOW. But... I don’t know if I’ll do it again.

... Takes a lotta guts to breathe underwater. That’s the biggest challenge. Tellin’ your brain that it’s okay to allow your body to do this thing it wasn’t fuckin’ made to do. Had to take ten minutes just to breathe calmly, you know, in and out, in and out. Tellin’ myself I wasn’t gonna die. Tellin’ myself I could always surface if shit went down. Wasn’t afraid to see a shark, wasn’t afraid to be left alone, was just... mostly afraid of breathin’. And that. Is some scary shit right there. Findin’ yourself afraid to breathe.
Always liked sharks. Did you see one?

Nah. But I tell everyone I did. Great White. Thirteen feet long. Two, three tons. Swims around me, lookin’ for lunch. Until I look that fucker in the eye and give him the middle finger. Just like that, shark swims away. He knew what’s what. Fuck, I love that story.
What’s on your list that you haven’t done?
I do wanna go to Japan one day. Heard a lot about it.
C’mon, man, we’ve been over this!
Well, I tried to call ‘em somethin’ else, and you didn’t know what the fuck I was talkin’ about! They got used girls’ panties!
Panties in vending machines! Least that’s what I heard. And I gotta see that shit.
I don’t give a fuck either way. It’ll be mind over matter on that one.
What about you, huh? What’s on your list?
Well, I... guess... I have always wanted to learn how to swing dance.
Yeah. Like get tossed around and stuff. It looks like a lot of fun. I think I’d be good at it.
And. I guess... I have been thinking about having an herb garden in my window... basil and stuff. And then. Try to remember to use it when I’m cooking. Which. Isn’t that often, but...

I wanna be a freaky birdwatcher in Central Park that knows about all the birds. Someone that can recognize their calls. I just wanna be a bird-lady... I wanna learn how to play the ukulele, and not be afraid to sing... even though I can’t really sing... I wanna see virgin rainforest before it disappears... some place in Brazil, maybe... I wanna... hablar español perfectamente and go to Oaxaca during Noche de Rábanos and eat all the things... I want to know Paris and London and Rome and Berlin and Barcelona like... they were my friends, and, yes... I want to stand at the edge of a fucking cliff in Greece... and dive off that mother fucker.
What do you mean, what else, I just told you so much.
What? Time for me to ante up?
How many chips you got on the table?
Two. We’re tied, remember? Two to two.
And it better be a good one.
I give you a good one... you’ll match me?
I’m not gonna let you win, that’s for damn sure.
All right, all right, I can hang.
And it has to be something personal, okay, not one of your little anecdotes.
Like... How’d you meet your wife?
The white lines in the dark asphalt - the separation of the lanes - guide the cab onward around a curve. Into the darkness. The unknown. What it feels like to live a life.
She threw up in my cab.

She was clubbin’ with her girlfriends. Ladies’ night or some shit. They were all in these tight dresses, and high heels, and smelled like booze and sweat and... flowers. Fuck. I was in Heaven. All these pretty ladies, crammed in my cab, sittin’ on each other’s laps, talkin’ so loud, laughin’ and screamin’ out the window, askin’ me to turn up the music like some disco ball was gonna drop from a fuckin’ moonroof. And, I gotta be honest - My cock was so hard, just poundin’ in my panties, ‘cause odds were, I was gettin’ lucky that night. And if I wasn’t lucky, I’d have plenty of good material to rub one out later, ya know?
And then, out of nowhere, blondie in the back doubles over and empties out her stomach. Which wasn’t holdin’ much, I am thankful to report.

Not much you can do. I drop ‘em off, light the “Off Duty,” get back to the garage, hose down the cab - and there it was. Her purse. Right there on the floor. Next day, she calls the company, gives an address. And me, bein’ the gentleman that I am... I offer to drop that shit off myself, and-uh... didn’t have to jerk off after payin’ her a visit, I can tell ya that.

Ah... she was a doll. Dumb as shit, but still... she was a sweetheart. Used to play pranks on her. You know, hide behind the couch and jump out, put sugar in the salt shaker, dumb shit like that. And... she always laughed about it. You know, she’d choose to laugh about it. Like... when somethin’ happens and you gotta choice. That choice to get pissed off or the choice to laugh it off... She’d laugh. She’d choose to laugh every time.

She did once. She-uh... she poured cold water on me when I was takin’ a shower. A bucket of ice water - Niagara Falls - right down on top of me. And I had that same choice, ya know. That choice whether to get pissed off or to laugh it off.

I laughed my fuckin’ ass off. Chased her ‘round the house in my birthday suit. She was screamin’ like a little girl, like we were playin’ tag or some shit... Finally caught her in the kitchen... That was a good day.
I bet she’s a lot smarter than you give her credit for.
I guess I do sometimes. Yeah... She was like a summer day, you know? Not too complicated. Just... a beer and a bag of chips... and we were set. Three to two. You gonna match me or what?
That last one’s a tough act to follow.
Surprised myself, I don’t talk about my shit!
You think I talk about my shit?!
So, there you go. That’s what’s on the table.
Let’s talk about shit. Let’s talk about allll the shit!
I’ll think of a good one.
Easy. Make it about your daddy.
Come on. There’s gotta be at least one more thing you haven’t told me. Something you are just dyin’ to say out loud. Take your time. Not like I’m goin’ nowhere.
Got a few more minutes, if you still wanna play for the win.
What’s left? What have you not told me?
Last night... my sister and I...

We got drunk. We got really drunk. And. We were sitting outside her trailer, and... she has these little chili pepper lights - like Christmas lights or something - draped all around. And... we sat there, in these old beach chairs, and just... drank and drank.
She was grilling up some burgers.
We did! I brought it up and she just... laughed. She laughed so hard, she cried. She didn’t apologize or anything- It was amazing.

Everything. We talked about the perms our mom used to give us, sitting on a stool in the kitchen, with this old pink towel draped over our shoulders... That smell... that perm smell... it’d stick around for days.
And we start talking about that day... the day she took me away. And I told my side of the story. And she told her side.

She told me that... our dad was on the porch that day. She told me that... we passed him on our way to her car. And then... she got in the car, and then, I got in the car. And then... we just drove away. She said that... he didn’t shake my hand that day. But. When I think back on it, it doesn’t make any sense, because... I remember it so clearly... even the feel of his hand... I remember thinking it felt like sandpaper.
And. So. Which of you is right? You or your sister?
I don’t know. But... if that memory isn’t real... the moment my father finally touched me... I don’t know what is...
I got a story kinda like that... ‘bout my pop. That moment when all the shit comes into focus. Then goes back out again. But- uh... that’s a whole other cab ride.
We’re tied again. Three to three.
We did a rain dance last night. The three of us... just drunk... but Eagle, Eagle showed us how.
Did it rain? Her eyes gloss over as she fights back tears...
That’s just the thing... Two weeks ago, when I flew to Oklahoma...
What’d your “daddy” have to say about that?
I never told him... I never told anyone.
You... get rid of the baby?

It got rid of me... First day in Oklahoma, I started bleeding. My sister didn’t know. I just told her I was having a bad period. Like a really shitty period... She let me sleep a lot. Gave me a heating pad and ice cream. But... after seven days, when I kept bleeding... I had to hide the tampons. Pretend it was just a regular period that ended... I had to get up and go out and meet all her friends and eat fucking barbecue and drink beer and go to a Thunder game... feeling like trash. I wasn’t going to keep it. I’d already made up my mind. I wasn’t going to keep it, and I wasn’t going to tell anyone. And then... when it happened, when it just... happened on its own... I was so relieved, I’ve never been so relieved in my life...
And then last night, when we were dancing... in my mind... I really did, I just begged the sky to rain down on me... To clean me... to wash it all away... the whole fucking thing.
I asked the sky to just take it from me. And then... this morning, when I woke up... I wasn’t bleeding anymore. After two weeks... it stopped.
Can’t beat that, that’s for sure.
Sorry, sweetie, uh... not quite sure where to stop.
Oh, uh- It’s the-uh, the brownstone- Right up there on the left.
I’ll leave you a big tip though.
Yeah, my advice don’t come free.
So... You gonna be all right?

Listen... Your brain... it’s just confused right now. It’s in a panic, ‘cause it ain’t used to breathin’ underwater. It’s gonna try to tell ya that you’re in way over your head, that this is it for you, no gettin’ out, you’re done, end of story... But you just... just keep on breathin’, all right? No matter how far down you go... you just keep on breathin’. ‘Cause someone like you, you are not a shipwreck. You’re gonna be all right. You’re gonna... swim yourself back up again... back to all that life and light and color... Might even see a blue whale.
What? The two stand, their feet planted a distance away from one another, though they seem only inches apart.
I always... sorta... felt like a Mikey. Not a Vinnie. Not a Clark. If it were up to me... I’d choose Mikey.
You too. They smile at one another in another suspended moment of stillness. Then---
Can’t blame a guy for tryin’.
Yeah, you take care of yourself, girlie.
